intro: Colythrum grandiflorum, commonly known as the greatflower cow-wheat, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the northeastern United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic species, and it typically grows in moist, shaded woodland habitats. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves and produces showy, pink to purple flowers in clusters during late spring to early summer. Its flowers are tubular and adapted for pollination by insects, and the plant often forms dense colonies in its native environment.
